conclusion: Analyze the particle's path in the magnetic field using given conditions about velocity and magnetic induction.
Setup with two uniform magnetic fields on either side of the plate a b. Positively charged particle injected at point c with initial velocity v0 at 45° to horizontal.
Particle collides with the plate, vertical component remains unchanged, horizontal component reverses. Particle leaves magnetic field at point f, 2d from c.
Particle's initial velocity v0 at 45° implies v0x = v0y = sqrt(2)/2 v0.
After collision, vertical component vy remains unchanged, horizontal component vx reverses, so vx = -v0x.
Particle's trajectory radius r at point f is given by r = mv0x/qB.
Since v0x = -vx at f, radius r = mvx/qB.
Using vx = sqrt(2)/2 v0, we have r = sqrt(2)mv0/(2qB).
Solving for B, we get B = sqrt(2)mv0/(4qd).
Substitute m = 1 and v0 = 2 into the equation to find B.
